*   **Regions of Delivery:** National Capital Region (NCR)

### Tender Overview

Health Canada requires Recipient/Contribution Agreement Audit services on an “as and when requested” basis. The goal of the Recipient Audit is to assess that recipients comply with the financial and non-financial terms and conditions of funding arrangements and that they have adequate management practices in place to support the delivery of services and the management of funding throughout its life-cycle.

### Audit Objectives

The objectives of the Recipient Audit are as follows:

*   Verify that recipients have met the financial and non-financial terms and conditions of funding arrangements
*   Assess the management practices of recipients to ensure they are adequate and high-quality
*   Ensure compliance with the terms and conditions of funding arrangements
*   Verify the management practices of recipients, including those related to program management, financial control, and data integrity
*   Verify the operational capacity of recipients to deliver services and program-funded activities.

### Key Requirements

#### Travel Requirements

Travel will be required for audits and assessments, with locations to be determined.

#### Reporting Requirements

Health Canada will require recipients to report their compliance with funding arrangements, program management, financial control practices, management practices, and data integrity.
